articles.title: Leah R Koenig
articles.contents:
Leah R. Koenig, MSPH
          
          
          CV
          Publications
          Media
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            Leah R Koenig
          
          
            
              I am a PhD student at the University of California, San
              Francisco. Currently I work on the Advancing New Standards
              in Reproductive Health team at UCSF. I love talking about
              abortion, missing data, and causal inference.
              
              Education
              University of California, San
              Francisco | San Francisco, CA
              Ph.D. in Epidemiology and Translational Sciences |
              Expected 2024
              NIH Predoctoral F31 and T32 Fellow
              Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public
              Health | Baltimore, MD
              M.S.P.H in Population, Family, and Reproductive Health
              | May 2017
              
            
            
              I am a PhD student at the University of California, San

articles.title: Media
articles.contents:
High Country News, “Navigating the new healthcare deserts: Post-Roe, startups help those seeking abortion shrink travel distances and carbon emissions”
New York Times, “Are Abortion Pills Safe? Here’s the Evidence.”
MSNBC, Morning Joe, “How the COVID pandemic impacted family planning”
Forbes, “Women less keen to get pregnant since the pandemic began, new study shows”

articles.title: Publications
articles.contents:
Peer-Reviewed Publications
Koenig LR, Raymond EG, Gold M, Kaneshiro B, Winikoff B, Coplon L, Upadhyay UD. Mailing abortion pills does not delay care: a cohort study comparing mailed to in-person dispensing of abortion medications in the United States. Contraception. 2023:109962.
Gayles J, Barker K, Yahner M, Lundgren R, Li M, Koenig LR, Mafuta E, Mbela P, Moreau C. Growing up GREAT! A longitudinal analysis of a gender-transformative intervention in Kinshasa, DRC. Journal of Adolescent Health. (Accepted for publication)
Koenig LR, Smith Hughes C, Gemmill A, Diamond-Smith N. Unequal impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic on women’s fertility preferences: Evidence from a longitudinal cohort in the United States. Social Science and Medicine - Population Health. 2022:101305.
Upadhyay UD, Raymond EG, Koenig LR, Coplon L, Gold M, Kaneshiro B, Boraas CM, Winikoff B. Outcomes and safety of history-based screening for medication abortion: a retrospective multicenter cohort study. JAMA Intern Med. 2022 May 1;182(5):482.
Upadhyay UD, Koenig LR, Meckstroth K. Safety and efficacy of telehealth medication abortions in the US during the COVID-19 pandemic. JAMA Network Open. 2021;4(8):e2122320–e2122320.
Koenig LR, Blum R, Shervington D, Green J, Li M, Wilopo S, Tabana H, Moreau C. Unequal gender norms are related to symptoms of depression among young adolescents: A cross-sectional, cross-cultural study. Journal of Adolescent Health. 2021;69(1):S47–55.
Zimmerman L, Koenig LR*, Pulerwitz J, Kayembe P, Maddaleno M, Moreau C. Disentangling power and gender norms: A case for addressing empowerment and gender unequal norms among young adolescents. Journal of Adolescent Health. 2021;69(1):S64–71.
Mmari K, Cooper D, Moreau C, Koenig LR, Martinez M, Mafuta E, Kayembe P, de Meyer S, Michielsen K, Yu C, Zuo X, Blum R. The social context of early adolescents in the Global Early Adolescent Study. Journal of Adolescent Health. 2021;69(1):S5–15.
Koenig LR, Li M, Zimmerman LA, Kayembe P, Lou C, Mafuta E, Ortiz J, Moreau C. Associations between agency and sexual and reproductive health communication in early adolescence: a cross-cultural, cross-sectional study. Journal of Adolescent Health 2020;67(3):416–24.
Dabash R, Shochet T, Hajri S, Chelli H, Hassairi AE, Haleb D, Labassi H, Sfar E, Koenig LR, Winikoff B. Self-administered multi-level pregnancy tests in simplified follow-up of medical abortion in Tunisia. BMC Women’s Health 2016;16(1):49.
Manuscripts under review and in preparation
Koenig LR, Ko J, Valladares E, Coeytaux F, Wells E, Lyles C, Upadhyay UD. A cohort study of patient acceptability of telehealth medication abortion care in the United States. (under review)
Koenig LR, Becker A, Ko J, Upadhyay UD. The role of telehealth abortion care in promoting equitable abortion access: a spatial analysis. (under review)
Raymond E, Weaver M, Shochet T, Grant M, Boyd K, Koenig LR, Upadhyay U. Clinical outcomes of medication abortion using misoprostol-only: a retrospective chart review at one clinic in the United States. (under review)
Koenig LR, Koenig LR, Ko J, Valladares E, Meckstroth K, Biggs A. Safety and effectiveness of synchronous and asynchronous telehealth medication abortion provided by U.S. virtual clinics. (under review)
Koenig LR, Pacca L, Hamad R, Vable A. Exploring U.S. state abortion policy trajectories from 1970 – 2014 using sequence analysis.
Koenig LR, Upadhyay UD. Masculinity Ideology Increases Sexual Risk Behaviors Among Adolescents and Young Adults.
Upadhyay UD, Koenig LR, Ko J, Sietstra C, Biggs A. Interest in late period pills in the United States: a nationally representative survey.
McMahon H, Koenig LR, Upadhyay UD, Karp C. Telehealth medication abortion in the United States: a scoping review.
Shin L, Koenig LR, Ko J, Upadhyay UD. Interest in Rh testing and Rho(D) immune globulin received among patients obtaining first-trimester medication abortion through virtual clinics.
Becker A, Doria C, Koenig LR, Becker A, Ko J, Upadhyay UD. “It was so easy in a situation that’s so hard”: how telehealth mitigates abortion stigma.
